During the night of 3â4 February, there were tanks on the street in Cairo as anti-government protesters stayed in Tahrir Square and pro-government protesters were also active. Many of the protesters spent the night again in Tahrir Square. Small scale clashes happened in the early hours.<ref name="aljazlive"/>
During the night of 3â4 February, there were tanks on the street in Cairo as anti-government protesters stayed in Tahrir Square and pro-government protesters were also active. Many of the protesters spent the night again in Tahrir Square. Small scale clashes happened in the early hours.<ref name="aljazlive"/>
â
Hundreds of thousands gathered to participate in Friday day prayer in Tahrir Square.<ref>http://blogs.aljazeera.net/node/3164</ref> The day's planned events were due to start after Friday prayers. Al Jazeera estimates the crowd size to be over a million so far in Tahrir Square while about half a million are protesting in Alexandria. Many protests took place in other cities in Egypt. The Alexandria protesters have warned the government that if they used violence against protesters in Cairo, they will march to Cairo to join the protesters there.<ref name="aljazlive"/>
+
Hundreds of thousands gathered to participate in Friday day prayer in Tahrir Square.<ref>http://blogs.aljazeera.net/node/3164</ref> The day's planned events were due to start after Friday prayers. Christians and others not performing Friday prayers have formed a "human chain" around those praying to protect them from any potential disruptions<ref name="aljazlive"/>. Al Jazeera estimates the crowd size to be over a million so far in Tahrir Square while about half a million are protesting in Alexandria. Many protests took place in other cities in Egypt. The Alexandria protesters have warned the government that if they used violence against protesters in Cairo, they will march to Cairo to join the protesters there.<ref name="aljazlive"/>
After his previous decision of preventing former ministers and government officials from traveling and freezing bank accounts, The Prosecutor General decided to prevent former minister of Trade and Industry Rashid Mohamed Rashid, from traveling outside the country and the freezing of accounts in banks. Rashid on a phone call with Alarabiya stated that "I returned from Davos to Egypt because of the current situation in Egypt. The new Prime Minister had contacted me for the same position in the new cabinet, I refused because I want fresh blood.". Regarding the prevention decision he commented "I had no idea about the accusations, I served for six and half years and I am completely ready to face any accusation. No one had informed me of this decision and I heard it from the news"/ It worth mentioning that Rashid enjoys a good reputation among Egyptian people. Rashid was a possible candidate for Prime Minister position before the events.
After his previous decision of preventing former ministers and government officials from traveling and freezing bank accounts, The Prosecutor General decided to prevent former minister of Trade and Industry Rashid Mohamed Rashid, from traveling outside the country and the freezing of accounts in banks. Rashid on a phone call with Alarabiya stated that "I returned from Davos to Egypt because of the current situation in Egypt. The new Prime Minister had contacted me for the same position in the new cabinet, I refused because I want fresh blood.". Regarding the prevention decision he commented "I had no idea about the accusations, I served for six and half years and I am completely ready to face any accusation. No one had informed me of this decision and I heard it from the news"/ It worth mentioning that Rashid enjoys a good reputation among Egyptian people. Rashid was a possible candidate for Prime Minister position before the events.

The New York Times reports that the US administration is in talks with Egyptian officials over a proposal for President Hosni Mubarak to resign immediately, turning over power to a transitional government headed by Vice- President Omar Suleiman<ref name="aljazlive"/>.
